title_full:
Ka Baird

              —
              Bearings: Soundtracks for the Bardos
            
              (RVNG Intl.)
label: RVNG Intl.
description:
New York mainstay Ka Baird returns with their most captivating full-length, a real heady trip informed by their ecstatic live performances rocketing classic Downtown minimalism towards far-flung galaxies. The album features a cast of avant-garde mavericks including Greg Fox, Max Eilbacher, Jon Mueller, Nate Wooley and others, and comes highly recommended for anyone into Laurie Anderson., Anna Homler/Breadwoman, Rashad Becker, Ben Vince x Heather Leigh.

'Bearings...' provides a... more

title_full:
Ulla & Ultrafog

              —
              it means a lot
            
              (Motion Ward)
label: Motion Ward
description:
Fizzing thru the aether like a half-remembered dream, Ulla and Ultrafog's collaborative debut is a surreal shimmer of imploded shoegaze-y guitar riffs, thick subs and lassoed vocals. Like an especially dissociated strain of hypnagogic pop, its sequence of trace recollections netted into a syrup of entrancing and half-speed ambience comes highly recommended if you’ve enjoyed work by Perila, Romance, Vincent Gallo, claire rousay or Oval. 

Not quite as smoky and diaphanous as Ultrafog's... more

release: And I Saw My Devil And I Saw My Deep Blue Sea
title_full:
Pentu

              —
              And I Saw My Devil And I Saw My Deep Blue Sea
            
              (Mappa Editions)
label: Mappa Editions
description:
A choppy collage of deranged synths, weightless melodies, machine errors, corroded vocals and guitar experiments, Pentu's latest is beautifully puzzling - the hyperactive ode to digital depression we've been waiting for.

The lightbulb moment came for Pentu when their laptop broke down at a gig and he was forced to reconsider his setup. Combined with the sudden end of a relationship and the aftermath of depression-inducing doomscrolling and social media fatigue, these events... more

title_full:
Chantal Michelle

            —
            ℎ− 2− ℎ− − 2 ℎ− (Dinzu Artefacts)

label: blush
description:
Poet, performer and NTS host Natalia Panzer teams up with Voice Actor’s Levi Lanser on 'key', a hazed fuzz of spoken word draped in lush, romantic atmospheres and half-heard samples. Properly delicate, weird, polychromatic pulp for fans of Voice Actor, Salenta + Topu, Laila Sakini, Coby Sey, Tricky, Jörg Follert.

There's a soft power to 'key' that comes as a surprise; initially its pebbly kicks and lopsided piano drench Panzer's downplayed, stateless voice, almost vanishing into the room's... more

label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description: Premiere vinyl edition of Carme López’ debut album of entrancing bagpipe arrangements, on constant rotation here since it came out on tape earlier this year. Unravelling forms of early music and funereal, queered droneworks full of strange tonalities, phased harmonics and curious subversions, ‘Quintela’ comes highly recommended If you’re into the verrrry slow chord-change organ dirges of Kali Malone, Pauline Oliveros’ Deep Listening or Yoshi Wada’s foundational bagpipe... more

release: pitter-patter, pit-pat, listen to the rain! pitter-patter, pit-pat, raining again...(se Dessaisir Publishing)
title_full:
Various Artists

            —
            pitter-patter, pit-pat, listen to the rain! pitter-patter, pit-pat, raining again...(se Dessaisir Publishing)

NUG (Florian TM Zeisig & Jordan Juras)

              —
              Bong Boat
            
              (West Mineral)
label: West Mineral
description:
Kelela collaborator Florian TM Zeisig and sound engineer Jordan Juras (aka PVAS) set us adrift in the Bavarian wilderness, red-eyed and zonked, with a buoyant raft of blissed ambient sorcery on their new album for Huerco S.’ West Mineral Ltd. Gorgeous, uplifting gear, tipped if yr into David Moufang’s Studio Pankow and Reagenz collabs, early William Orbit, 154, GAS.

Successor to their Mo Wax flavoured debut album ‘Napping Under God’ (3XL, 2022), the languorous wooze of ‘BonGBoaT’... more

label: 3XL
description:
Pent ventures a debut statement of crisp and aerated ambient electronica and post-club diffusions via shy’s 3XL nexus - one for fans of Kindohm, Perko, Kakuhan.

On ‘Trepidation Cycles’ Pent trades in a style of shearing sound design and displaced rhythmic syntax primed for listeners who like it abstract but just about yoked back from all out oddness. We can tell you bot all about their background, but the music speaks on its own merits with a keen exploration of im/possible physics perfused... more
